Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Clovibactin (Leu-rich; natural AMPs; nonribosomal peptide, Gram-negative bacteria, prokaryotes, depsipeptide, lactone, XXJ, XXK, XXD2; UCSB1b; BBW)

Literature Information.Literature: Discovery: isolated from unculltured soil bacteria.Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (50%) toTemporin-RaL: 38%.Chemical modification: Leu2 and Lys3 are D-amino acids (XXD), Asn5 is beta-hydroxylated (XXK), the hydroxyl group of Asn5 forms an ester bond with the carboxyl group of C-terminal Leu8 (XXJ).Activity: Active against primarily Gram-positive pathogens, S. aureus susceptible and resistant strains NCTC 8325 NRS108 NRS71 MRSA Mu50 VISA (MIC 0.125-2 ug/ml), S. epidermidis ATCC 35982 or NRS8 (MIC 0.5 ug/ml), S. haemolyticus NRS9 or NRS69 (MIC 0.5-1 ug/ml), E. faecium BM4147 VRE (MIC 0.5-2 ug/ml), anti-VRE, B. subtilis 1A1 or 168 (MIC 1-2 ug/ml), B. anthracis Sterne (MIC 0.25 ug/ml), S. pneumoniae ATCC10813 (MIC 0.25-0.5 ug/ml), S. pyogenes ATCC19615 (MIC 0.25-0.5 ug/ml), S. warneri NRS138 (MIC 1 ug/ml), M. smegmatis MC2 155 (MIC 2 ug/ml), M. tuberculosis MC2 6020 (MIC 0.5-1 ug/ml), Gram- H. influenzae SJ7 (MIC 2 ug/ml), E. coli K12 (MIC 64 ug/ml), and P.aeruginosa PA-01 (MIC >128 ug/ml).MOA:bacteria: Peptide can oligomerize into supramolecular fibrils due to a beta-sheet peptide structure upon contact with target. Clovibactin blocks cell wall synthesis by targeting pyrophosphate of multiple essential peptidoglycan precursors (C55PP, Lipid II, LipidWTA).Resistance development:no:bacteria:S. aureus: resistance frequency <10power-10. multiple targets explain lack of resistance. More data needed. Provided by Nongnuj Tanphaichitr.Updated 7/2024
Literature Information.Author: Shukla R, Peoples AJ, Ludwig KC, Maity S, Derks MGN, De Benedetti S, Krueger AM, Vermeulen BJA, Harbig T, Lavore F, Kumar R, Honorato RV, Grein F, Nieselt K, Liu Y, Bonvin AMJJ, Baldus M, Kubitscheck U, Breukink E, Achorn C, Nitti A, Schwalen CJ, Spoering AL, Ling LL, Hughes D, Lelli M, Roos WH, Lewis K, Schneider T, Weingarth M. 2023
Literature Information.Title: An antibiotic from an uncultured bacterium binds to an immutable target.
